articles.author: Amina Ismail, Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: With U.S. elections approaching, officials, diplomats and other sources in the region say Israel is seeking to shield its borders and ensure its rivals cannot regroup.
articles.title: Israel intensifies offensive in Gaza, Lebanon after Hamas leader's death

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The United States is investigating the leak of a pair of highly classified intelligence documents describing Israel's preparations for a retaliatory strike on Iran, House Speaker Mike Johnson said on Sunday.
articles.title: US investigates leak on intelligence about Israel's Iran attack plans

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The U.N. peacekeeping force in Lebanon (UNIFIL) said in a statement that an Israeli army bulldozer had demolished an observation tower and perimeter fence of a U.N. position in Marwahin in southern Lebanon on Sunday.
articles.title: UNIFIL says Israeli army demolished watchtower and fence at UN site in southern Lebanon

articles.author: Dave Sherwood
articles.description: Cuba's efforts to restore power to the island were derailed for a third time late on Saturday, Cuban authorities said shortly before midnight, leaving millions in the dark and raising fresh questions over the viability of the government's bid to reestablish electrical service.
articles.title: Cuba suffers third major setback in restoring power to island, millions still in dark

articles.author: Lucy Papachristou
articles.description: Some experts say Georgia might return to Russia's orbit.
articles.title: Georgian president delivers pro-EU message at opposition rally as election looms

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said on Sunday he was seeking a strong reaction from countries who have acknowledged that North Korea is becoming more involved in Russia's more than 2-1/2-year-old war against Ukraine.
articles.title: Ukraine's Zelenskiy seeks strong reaction to North Korean involvement in war

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: President Vladimir Putin told the visiting president of the United Arab Emirates on Sunday that relations between the two states amounted to a "strategic partnership" and thanked him for mediation efforts in exchanging prisoners of war with Ukraine.
articles.title: Putin says Russia, UAE have 'strategic partnership', to discuss Middle East, Ukraine

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The recent statements by the U.S. President Joe Biden's administration that Washington is ready for nuclear talks without preconditions with Russia, China and North Korea are "deception," Russia's foreign minister Sergei Lavrov said.
articles.title: Russia calls US statements on readiness for nuclear talks 'deception'

articles.author: Ananda Teresia, Stefanno Sulaiman
articles.description: Indonesia's Prabowo Subianto on Sunday will take over as president of the world's third-largest democracy after sweeping the country's election with policies like free meals for school children and with the outgoing leader's son as his running mate.
articles.title: Former special forces commander Prabowo to take up Indonesian presidency

articles.author: Lewis Jackson
articles.description: King Charles and Queen Camilla will fly to Australia's capital Canberra on Monday where crowds are expected to gather for their first visit to the city in almost a decade.
articles.title: King Charles and Queen Camilla to visit Canberra on Australia tour
